revised_title: Inversion of Surface Electric Fields for Surface-Breaking Crack Characterization
tldr: This article presents a method for predicting the shape and size of surface-breaking cracks in metal sheets using alternating current electric fields. The theoretical model is formulated using the potential and streamfunction as independent variables, and the shape of the lower edge of the crack is determined from the solution of a Fredholm integral equation of the first kind. The method is tested using theoretical distributions of potential from known crack shapes, showing very good agreement.
